items.title: [THINKING] Consequential Thinking
items.worker_notes: Decision-making/problem solving work.
items.text: Consequential Thinking: To learn what is meant by consequential thinking and how it can be applied. Identify temptations and problem solving, raise awareness of obstacles to reduce re-offending, identify decision making and coping skills, and how to apply consequential thinking and improve decision making. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [WELLBEING] Anxiety
items.worker_notes: Structured work on anxiety and recovery impact.
items.text: Anxiety: To learn and understand the meaning of anxiety (good & bad) and how this can impact on recovery. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [WELLBEING] Emotional Health
items.worker_notes: Emotional triggers and safer management.
items.text: Emotional Health: To learn how to build emotional health and how to safely manage emotional triggers which may lead to drug/alcohol use. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [WELLBEING] Rumination
items.worker_notes: Understanding rumination and coping.
items.text: Rumination: To learn what is meant by rumination and how best to respond to this positively. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [WELLBEING] Anger Management

items.title: [SUBSTANCE] Substance Awareness (stimulants/depressants)
items.worker_notes: General drug class education.
items.text: Substance Awareness: To increase knowledge of depressants and stimulants, and develop a better understanding of how they affect mood, interact with other drugs, and implications on physical and mental health. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [ALCOHOL] Alcohol Awareness
items.worker_notes: Alcohol impacts + mixing with stimulants/depressants.
items.text: Alcohol awareness: To look at effects of alcohol on liver and mental and physical health and the effects it has when mixed with stimulants and depressants. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [ALCOHOL] Alcohol & Violence
items.worker_notes: Alcohol, mood, aggression and consequences.
items.text: Alcohol and Violence: To look at effects of alcohol on mood and subsequent aggression that can present following consumption of large amounts of alcohol and the resulting consequences. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [ALCOHOL] Recovery Skills (safer drinking/moderation)
items.worker_notes: Drinking moderation/safer drinking skills.
items.text: Recovery Skills: To look at ways to control how much I drink so I can drink safer and in moderation. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [ALCOHOL] Workbook (risk to self/others & safer management)
items.worker_notes: Use when completing an alcohol workbook in 1:1 contact and focusing on risks + safer management.
items.text: Alcohol workbook: Client to read and complete workbook which Recovery Coordinator will go through during 1:1 contact, allowing the client to ask questions and discuss areas he is unsure of. Aim is to develop better understanding of risks to self and others and improve management of self when drinking. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [SUBSTANCE] Amphetamines
items.worker_notes: Effects/risks + mixing with alcohol.
items.text: Amphetamines: To look at effects of amphetamines and how they work in the body and the risks they present when over used and used with other drugs, particularly alcohol. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [SUBSTANCE] Benzodiazepines
items.worker_notes: Effects/risks + mixing.
items.text: Benzodiazepines: To look at effects of benzodiazepines and how they work in the body and the risks they present when over used and used with other drugs. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [SUBSTANCE] Cannabis (effects & addictive qualities)

items.title: [SUBSTANCE] Cannabis (how it affects me)
items.worker_notes: Cannabis personal impact wording.
items.text: Cannabis: To have a better understanding of how cannabis affects me and the impact it has on mental and physical health. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [HARM REDUCTION] Harm Reduction (awareness)
items.worker_notes: Shorter harm reduction awareness wording (separate from the detailed DVT/BBV/Hepatitis version).
items.text: Harm Reduction: To increase awareness, knowledge and understanding around the subject of harm reduction. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [HARM REDUCTION] Harm Reduction (structured work)
items.worker_notes: Care plan structured harm reduction education (more detailed).
items.text: Harm Reduction: To gain knowledge and understanding of ways to reduce risks of overdose, death and potential long term health issues by using harm reduction methods, and being fully aware of overdose risks posed by using illicit drugs and associated health implications (e.g. DVT, BBVs, Hepatitis). Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.title: [HARM REDUCTION] Harm Min (initial/phone appointment topics)
items.worker_notes: Initial/phone appointment topics as per source list.
items.text: Harm min: Discussion and information given at initial and during phone appointment – tolerance, BBV, relapse prevention, consequential thinking, and debt. To understand ways to reduce risks of overdose, death and potential long term health issues by using harm reduction methods and being fully aware of overdose risks posed by using illicit drugs. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.

items.text: Naloxone: To increase overdose awareness, recognise signs of overdose and learn how to administer Naloxone safely and put someone in the recovery position while waiting for an ambulance. Delivery: Structured 1:1s, in-depth discussions, maps, information and/or workbooks.
